reviewText: Yes, I WISH that this show series would come back on DVD. I started doing the 20 Minute Workout while I was in medical school one summer. I would have to get up for the 5:30AM show - and I tell you, NOTHING since this show has had me up ROUTINELY at 5:20AM getting aerobics, abdominal work and toning exercises. I'm NOT an aerobics junkie and I found Fonda's tapes to be boring. This show is FUN! The music is uplifting, not LOUD and keeps you going. The exercises FLOW from one to another. And the 20 Minutes flies by fast.Using this program, I was finally able to slim my waist enough to get into a pair of Vanderbilt white cotton pant. Nothing chizeled my waist like this workout. I have found myself thinking of the music often, and know some of the routines by heart. I've misplaced this copy, which is why I'm getting another.Do yourself a favor, BUY ALL of the 20 Minute Workout series you can. You'll love 'em.By the way, this program can EASILY be adjusted to low impact. Get started and watch the pounds melt away.
summary: The Show That Got Me Into The Best Shape of My Life!
Title: N/A

reviewText: "20 Minute Workout"Bring Aerobicise back! Where is the DVD version?This is a quote from a fan that I borrowed... AEROBICISE and/or 20 MINUTE WORKOUT was the best ever fitness program one can use to stay fit. The young ladies were very attactive (and they know it) If you are serious about getting into shape, nothing else will do.Okay whatever... The original 20 minute workout from the 80's featured very fit women doing aerobics on a rotating platform. The music had the same tempo as the soundtrack on a porno movie.  Yes it was exercise but mostly it was HOT! Does anyone remember this show?It was on cable and was used as a 20 minute filler between movies on HBO or Cinemax.Producers of this program: Are you still out there? Bring this show back! It would be exceedingly popular again!!!
summary: Bring Aerobicise back! The original 20 Minute Workou! Where is the DVD version?
Title: N/A

reviewerName: E. Byrne "No one can make you feel inferior w...
reviewText: I used to do this workout with my mom when I was in elementary and middle school. She still has the VHS and loves it. It is a great challenging work out and always keeps you motivated to do more. I wish it were available on DVD.
summary: The best work out video ever!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love working out to 80's classics like Jane Fonda's earlier work, but 20 minute workout is hypnotic. It really transports you to a time where you get dressed up for fitness - you went to the effort of getting spandex, reeboks and leg warmers , instead of today's attitude where a huge baggy tshirt saying "I'm a health nut!" is used to cover 400 pound's of some one's body/whale blubber(a baggy tshirt only hides so much!) Just play it for even 20 seconds and you could just watch the whole thing. I bought this with an ebay lot. I can't get over how 80's and amazing it is. I don't know if the exercises are still safe or meet to code, but that doesnt matter!! The music is a must too! It literally grabs you and gets you to work out.Worth watching or projecting on to a large wall and opening your own New Wave 80's club. Either way it is worth watching
Title: N/A

reviewText: I think the 20 Minute workout features all women. This should be made on DVD and Blu-Ray. Try adding a maximum of 5 pound ankle and hand weights for better results.
